body: Presuming I haven't messed this up, I'd love to get this fixed before 4.1.26 since it would make it really difficult to use symmetric pipelines for our HTTP/2 and HTTP/1.x clients.
This sounds like a bug... interested in working on a PR?
Absolutely, just wanted confirmation that I wasn't just using it wrong. ðŸ˜„

Just to be clear, I think the deferred close operations is what we want, correct? I could see it going the other way: technically the `ctx.close` was called first, but the operation is asynchronous so it seem like legal behavior to defer the events.
Yes just as for normal channels

As an aside, looking at the `DefaultHttp2StreamChannel`, it duplicates a lot of stuff from `AbstractChannel`. I'm sure it didn't extend `AbstractChannel` for a good reason, but I don't know where that discussion happened. Does anybody have any pointers to that?

@bryce-anderson I think at some point it did extend it but I changed it (my memory may be wrong here) because something was not needed and did not even work then extending the `AbstractChannel`. If I am not wrong this was related to the `ChannelOutboundBuffer`.

issue.title: Defer channelInactive and channelUnregistered events in Http2MultiplexCodec

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

There is an inconsistency between the order of events in the
StreamChannel implementation in Http2MultiplexCodec and other Channel
implementations that extend AbstractChannel where channelInactive and
channelUnregistered events are not performed 'later'. This can cause an
unexected order of events for ChannelHandler implementations that call
Channel.close() in response to some event.

Modification:

The Http2MultiplexCodec.DefaultHttp2StreamChannel.Http2ChannelUnsafe was
modified to bounce the deregistration and channelInactive events through
the parent channels EventLoop.

Result:

Stream events are now in the proper order.

Fixes #8018.

body: @bryce-anderson thanks for the PR and yes I agree we should see if we can make `AbstractChannel` useable for it in the next major release.
